website_summaries.verdict: While these gloves look good and are extremely waterproof, they aren't the best choice for extended outdoor wear, especially in winter extremes.
pros: Waterproof with 3M Thinsulate and touchscreen fingers
These gloves aren't bulky like some others
cons: May not keep hands warm enough during extended periods of cold exposure

customer_reviews.title: Dry Dry Dry!
customer_reviews.text: Warm and super fit! Everything is as described. It’s both waterproof and breathable. Material seems to be durable. Time will tell. Hopefully it can be my cold weather multiple condition glove. Ready for the ski season!
customer_reviews.author: GQ

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get these gloves for walking my dog here in Alaska but they disappointed me! Wore them for the first time this morning in 39 deg sunshine and my fingers were freezing! Had to take them off to warm up my hands in my pants pockets. Sending them back ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L. West

customer_reviews.title: Not for colder (10 degrees or lower) temperature.
customer_reviews.text: They are fine unless it is cold outside. I live in northern Minnesota and we haven't even gotten below zero yet and my fingers are burning with cold. I put knit gloves underneath them and it still doesn't help. I wish I would have saved my money for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Sista Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Worst glove ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst glove ever! So waterproof that if you sweat, the inside doesn’t dry and end up smelly. Impossible to wash properly as you cannot turn these inside out easely. That was a waste of money and these are not even that warm, especially when the inside is moist.
customer_reviews.author: Amelie Dricot

customer_reviews.title: Warm snow gloves
customer_reviews.text: We went to skiing with these gloves last weekends and I found such pros and cons. Pros: It's a pair of warm gloves. The materials are thick enough to keep away the cold weather. I can move my fingers freely. There are wrist bands that you can hold with. I bought gloves in yellow. It’s really a bright color in the snow covered mountains. Cons: They are not absolute waterproof. The surface would get wet but my hands are still dry. The water can’t get through the gloves to my hands. It’s the tricky part. Overall, they are good snow gloves with such price.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Best skiing glove I have ever encountered!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these gloves for a skiing trip to Utah. I was beyond happy that I had them!! They kept me not only warm and toasty but dry the entire time. My favorite feature of the gloves are the wrist strap so that you can quickly remove the gloves in a pinch without having to hold them between your arms or knees; these hang from your wrists while you are free to do what you need with your hands without dropping your gloves. I HIGHLY recommend them. I’d love to be able to get these for my kids as well!!
customer_reviews.author: MrsOrganized

customer_reviews.title: My Absolute Favorite Winter Gloves
customer_reviews.text: All winter long I had semi- thin “fashionable” leather driving gloves. Very pretty and looked nice without the bulk- but I was freezing!! I finally broke down and went looking for something substantial and Warm. These gloves absolutely fit the bill. Honestly it is very cold here and every time I wore them I never again thought about the cold. We’ve gone sledding many times and I could finally participate without freezing!! They aren’t too bulky that you can’t handle things- the color is complementary to the usual winter wear- over all amazing purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Claire David

customer_reviews.title: The very end finger tips get cold easily (my fingers aren't that long though) and the extra ...
customer_reviews.text: I work outside majority of the time. In North Dakota winters (sub zero temps, wind chill, and snow), I need a warm pair of gloves that I can wear while holding onto freezing metal all day. I was pleasantly surprised with these!! I got a little larger size (to give some room for air/insulation). The very end finger tips get cold easily (my fingers aren't that long though) and the extra fabric gets on the way sometimes but otherwise they are great. Will probably order again!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Served their purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for short ski trips around northeast WA. I read a lot of these reviews before just going for it and getting them. The one-star reviews scared me by saying wind cut straight through, they didn't stay dry, etc. but for my purposes those things were just not true. Another reviewer said she got these in size large because she has bigger hands, but if she'd gotten mediums they would've fit better. I agree. The color is a little weird, yellow but almost green in certain lighting. Otherwise, they're good gloves that served their purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah May

customer_reviews.title: These are working for me
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I am writing this review in the Amazon app WHILE WEARING THE GLOVES. I use my phone constantly and I wanted to be able to continue to do so while staying warm on the slopes. Is it taking longer than normal? Yes, but I'm ok with it. These fit comfortably and came packaged with a thank you note including info about warranty that I thought was a nice touch. I'll update my review after the next ski trip!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: But 3M Thinsulate is actually a pretty value added to the product
customer_reviews.text: It fits as expected, tested to be water-resistant. Never expected it to be one of the high-tech fabric. But 3M Thinsulate is actually a pretty value added to the product. Other than the potential of water-resistivity differences, it pretty much does the same job as another pair of black diamond gloves which cost me 70 bucks. Anyway, It's a good bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, Comes apart after one month
customer_reviews.text: Ive used them maybe 4 times when walking my dog outside and they are coming apart in the palm. Very disappointed. Ive only had them a month! But Of course its a few days past the 30 day return.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Rowell

customer_reviews.title: Too warm- hands sweat and gloves won’t dry.
customer_reviews.text: Super warm and fit great, but the insides will not dry. Even had them on a heater overnight. Has been three nights and still the fingertips are moist.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kept my hands warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: I gambled and bought the large gloves, and they were a tad large on me. I have large hands for a woman, but these were a true large. Other than that, they worked wonders! I used them during winter in Iceland and it kept my hands warm and dry. I would advise sizing down so that the gloves are snug and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina M. Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Poor stitching
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get these gloves for an upcoming trip but disappointed when I tried them on and noticed that the seam under the thumb was coming apart. If I had more time I would have sent them back but I mended them as I needed them immediately. Hopefully the warmth and waterproof claims are more accurate than the quality claim. Incidentally I ordered two sizes and kept the large. There was plenty of room in the fingers in the medium size but it was a little restrictive when I opened my hand.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Very nice fit and warm
customer_reviews.text: Very very nice gloves Flexible, well made and wide. I purchased large and expected a large and that is what I got. They fit my hands width wise njcely and I can bend my hands. Shoveled with them today in 25 degrees and didnt feel any cold. And coming from me who hates cold weather that means alot. Dont expect 100% water proof gloves but they certainly look aster rssistant.. obviously if you put your hands in water during the winter obviously you would be cold.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail E. Allen

customer_reviews.title: These never dry inside
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning these. They are very warm and comfy when you first try them on. But after 30 mins of wear, they got a little damp inside and NEVER dried. Even after one full week. I think it’s just so bunched up inside the gloves that there’s no air circulation to dry them. Design flaw. And this is in very dry Colorado.
customer_reviews.author: SLEEME

customer_reviews.title: Gloves don’t allow the hands to breathe
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, and the gloves are definitely waterproof. I used these gloves on my Colorado ski trip this month & the gloves didn’t vent or breathe very well, leaving my hands to sweat and stay damp the entire time. The finger tips worked good and the wristbands were a plus. Nice glove, just wouldn’t recommend for skiing.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Keep your hands really warm put flexible.
customer_reviews.text: I am a transplant of 2 years from CA and I don't like cold weather. My family does a lot of cross country skiing and after 2 miserable winters I got serious about protecting my body, hopefully, so I can last longer. They keep the melting snow out with the wrist tightener and I never had cold hands once. I live in Upstate NY and I'm cold here almost year-round. I would encourage people to buy these. You'll have to take your gloves off the play with your smartphone but if that's your priority stay in the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Tore upon first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife and BOTH gloves tore at the seam by the wrist the first time she put them on, and it's not because she pulled hard. The "small" gloves were actually way too big for her hands, so it didn't require much force to put them on. Nevertheless, they tore.
customer_reviews.author: Unavailable

customer_reviews.title: Touchscreen works!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because I just wanted some cheap gloves for a one time trip. I am one to ALWAYS buy based off reviews so I wanted to share my honest review. I wasn’t expecting much due to the cheap price but they fit perfect! I got size medium, don’t let the picture fool you, they look big on the picture but they’re not so do not size down. (I almost did ) They’re very comfy/warm and the touch screen works GREAT. They look just like the picture and the material feels like good quality. As for water resistance we will find out when I go on my trip. But I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Threads Separating after 3 DAYS
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 different pairs of gloves from Amazon for a ski trip. I ended up keeping this pair and returning the other 2 which now I feel might've been a mistake... I wore these gloves for all of 3 days while skiing. They fit great, kept my hands/fingers warm, and were easy to take off and on. Unfortunately, after 3 days of skiing (and NO other snow activity) the threads on these gloves are already separating. I'm very disappointed with the quality. I expected them to last longer than 3 days. I would NOT recommend these gloves to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: SadieTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for snowy New York
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves for snowy New York. Didn’t let a drop of water through. Very warm even in a snow fight. However I found the finger touch use on the iPhone a little tricky. When it was super cold it wouldn’t work as it said. U had to heat it up with your breath before it would work on the phone. That’s my only complaint though. They’re awesome otherwise. The touchscreen functionality worked about 50% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Noel

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable gloves. Very soft on the inside and rugged on the outside while maintaining ease of motion. It is nice to be able to use your phone while wearing, and the fingertips seem responsive. The only downfall is that you will have "fat" fingers and need to readjust how you interact with your phone. Some of the seams get in the way. To me, that is a very minor issue. I have not put them to the test out in the snow yet, but my initial star rating is 5/5. The product quality is legit and I anticipate they should work great.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Punches

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: These are so stylish and sleek and they kept my hands warm while skiing in Tahoe. That is until I took them off. The interior fleece lining isn't tacked inside causing the lining to pull out with my hand. I was never able to get my right hand back in the glove. Two of my fingers were perpetually curled inside the palm of the glove- not comfortable. Also, the fleece traps all moisture so it's quite cold once you put them back on. Thank god they were cheap so I feel less bad if I toss them. Next time, I'll spend a bit more
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are very comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very comfortable and warm. The sizing was a little odd for me. Fit perfect for my hand shape and thumb, but the other fingers were overly large by a good inch or so. It makes it difficult to properly use the fingertips to use your cellphone. I have to pull the fingers down and taut to use them. Could be that my hands are odd :) Either way, the fingertips DO work well with touch screens.
customer_reviews.author: Jam

customer_reviews.title: Not quite warm as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a while now and have used it in 20's weather as well as mid teen's weather. The fits is sort of just average for me, the feel of inside is comfortable, the touch for the phone works well, and the length is good enough for me. The only issue for me is that It doesnt keep my fingers warm enough. I have used these outside while clearing snow off my car and other stuff and as soon as I get inside I had to put my fingers by the heater. It just doesn't work well enough as advised. I would recommend a glove liner to be use with this.
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Medium was way to big for a women. Fingers still freeze in temps below 20.
customer_reviews.text: The medium were way to big. I guess medium was for a giant man size hand. I returned the medium and got a size small and they are a good fit glove somewhat. Thumbs are way too long. When it got to -7 below, my fingers were frozen after playing with the dogs for 20 minutes outside. If the weather stays above 30 they keep me warm. I ended up double laying with a wool glove for the below 0 temps and it kept them warmer for a little long but they still get very cold after a long time outside.
customer_reviews.author: TammyH

customer_reviews.title: Snug fit. Choose larger size.
customer_reviews.text: I have normal-sized female hands. I ordered extra large instead of a large because I wanted a little bit of room. I’m glad that I did that because these do fit a little snug. They feel great when you get them on, but if you need to take them off and on during use as with skiing or sledding it is very difficult to get them back on. The wrist length and closure are nice. The material and color are great. I have yellow. If you have larger hands for a woman I would recommend getting the men’s instead.
customer_reviews.author: Valorie Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof Gloves Failed to Provide Warmth
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves for my wife to wear during a trip to Quebec during the Christmas holidays. The gloves failed to keep her hands warm and she always had to insert hand warmers inside the gloves. The first two times she wore the gloves her hands nearly froze. No warmth protection at all. I'm very disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.author: NewLawDad

customer_reviews.title: 20 Degree + windchill tested
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the high reviews without reading about the touch screen feature. I can't believe thick gloves like this can work with touch screens, but they do! I used these gloves for hours in 20 degree windy and snowy weather. My hands stayed warm. The outer layer got a little wet, but that didn't affect the inside. I highly recommend them- especially for the price. They are comparable to the $60 gloves I have bought in the past.
customer_reviews.author: S. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Best we've ever gotten
customer_reviews.text: I got two for my early teen girls who are hard on gloves. We normally have to get new gloves every year, but these made it through a whole winter and look like they'll last at least another one. They are also warmer than others we've had, they didn't need another set of gloves underneath. And they keep dry longer than other winter gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof - soaking wet by end of ski run
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a ski trip to Park City, Utah. The one good thing Incan day about these, is they kept my hands dry-ish/warm. At first they seemed great with a nice and tight fit and dry to the touch. As our day progressed, the gloves began to become soaking wet. The gloves are completely obsolete with trying to use your cell phone as they don’t allow for much movement and dexterity.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha C.

customer_reviews.title: Good glove for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 4 pair of these gloves for a December ski trip in Colorado. Weather was in the low 20’s. For the price I think they are a good value and I’d likely buy them again. I’m not sure you’ll find better ones at this price. They kept our hands dry from the snow. The only issue we had was that our hands sweat in them and they don’t wick away the sweat so when you take them off and put them back on they are damp inside which can be cold. We dried them in a dryer at night for the next day but it takes 2-3 cycles to get the insides dry.
customer_reviews.author: Brandee

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Wore them skiing, kept me warm on a 10 degree f freezing day. Waterproof. Touch screen works, however, gloves are stiff (as ski gloves should be) so you can't really use the touch screen because of the stiffness of the fingers. Basically opened my phone from locked but couldn't really use it. but still loved the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: warm, waterproof, love the adjustable strap. Seem made to last. Cons: fingers are all almost the same size and the thumb is HUGE. My middle and ring finger fit fine. But using a touchscreen is not really practical as the index finger has empty space on top. I have pretty long fingers, too. But they’re warm and seem well made otherwise. Maybe all ski gloves are like this, I don’t know.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gastia

customer_reviews.title: These gloves actually stay dry inside even when the outside is saturated
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of ski gloves I have had yet! I need warm gloves not for skiing but for working outdoors on a farm. I have tried many different brands of gloves and not one of them stayed dry inside , not one! I live in MT so temps can easily drop well below zero, if gloves get wet inside your hands will be frozen within minutes. These gloves have stayed 100% dry inside , even after cleaning out a livestock watering trough. Best gloves I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Robinson

customer_reviews.title: They run small but keep you warm
customer_reviews.text: The gloves do run small. I have small hands and I ordered the large and they fit. That being said. That is the very worse I can say. I ordered them for driving as I am always cold and they work wonderfully. Last weekend I used them for Thier intended purpose and with them while snow tubing, my hands were actually sweating, something that never happens. They are worth every penny in my book.
customer_reviews.author: phoenix2012

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic- I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic- I love it! It is so convenient to have touch screen gloves!! They are warm and soft on the inside and look sturdy on the outside. The one downside is that I snowboard with wrist braces- and these gloves are a smidge too tight to wear comfortably over the braces :/ I am wondering if a larger size would fix this issue, but then the gloves would be too big for my hands...
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: ski gloves
customer_reviews.text: I received the ski gloves in a timely fashion. I ordered the large and they seem a little small. However, I was able to get them on and don't have time to return them so I am going to go with them. The service was good and the size would be no one's fault but mine. I did receive the size I ordered. I have slender hands, but very long fingers so finding gloves has always been an issue. I believe these are going to work just fine. The quality is very good, so I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen McGrew

customer_reviews.title: My Hands Froze!
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought these gloves to wear skiing as I didn’t have any water resistant gloves. These worked HORRIBLY! My hands were so cold after each run down the mountain, we would have to go into the lodge to warm up. It was between 1 - 20 degrees during my trip and they never were warm enough. I ended up wearing another pair of gloves that were not water resistant under my nephew’s gloves so I could keep skiing. Will never trust this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: KaylaG

customer_reviews.title: Quality, warm gloves
customer_reviews.text: Nice product but a bit snug and the fingers are a bit long for me. I'm a woman and bought a sz LG so not sure if a med would have fit bit the fingers would probably be shorter. Quality is very good and since I didn't buy them for skiing but just cold weather I think they'll be fine. Appear waterproof. Didn't try touchscreen.
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves and a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves for my girlfriend for Colorado where the temperature got down to 7 degrees and they worked amazing. These gloves held up through skiing, sledding, and tubing without her hands getting cold at all. I highly recommend buying these gloves if you are looking for nice gloves to keep your hands warm without spending a ton of money on gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Djam28

customer_reviews.title: keps tips of fingers always warm
customer_reviews.text: Wore this skiing too. And another pleasant surprise. Fingers always stayed warm! I'm 69 years old, and from Florida, so keeping by old bod warm is a real trick. But these gloves did it! Nice job. By fingers are grateful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These gloves keep your hands warm!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for gloves that keep my hands warm in cold temps... 20s and below. These gloves really do keep my hands warms. The only thing I don’t like is that they are a little bulky, making it hard to do anything requiring dexterity in your fingers. So I will use these gloves when shoveling snow or walking.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Warm in 32 degree weather!!
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and warm! Wore these in 32 degree weather while it was snowing, throwing snowballs and running around. They kept my hands very warm and no water got in at all!! They have two different places to cinch your wrist to keep in warmth. Very nice. Not sure if i bought these too big but i could not get my phone to work with the touchscreen fingertips but i dont mind it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal B.

customer_reviews.title: so the touchscreen capability is pretty much wasted
customer_reviews.text: Bought these gloves to take with me to Alaska, where we saw temps reach -30F. I paired these with a liner, and my fingers never froze, so I call that a win. The fingers are a bit stiff, but I imagine they'll break in over time. It's also nearly impossible to use your phone with them on, so the touchscreen capability is pretty much wasted. They're just too bulky for that. As far as doing their primary job, though, they're good gloves!
customer_reviews.author: M. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: More so unisex than women's but soft and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are too short and wide for me to consider them to be women's gloves. Not sure why manufacturers can't figure that out! But they are soft and provide the water and wind protection that I need. I have 2 pairs of linings that easily slide into these gloves..... for someone whose hands get cold easily these are not enough on their own.
customer_reviews.author: amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: fingers are short, tore the first time I used them, actually were warm though
customer_reviews.text: I took these on a backpacking trip where it was going to be in the 30's and raining. I pulled them out of my bag to put them on the first time and the thumb tore in the palm seam. The fingers are short (like others mentioned), but did keep my hands and fingers warm. I can't keep them with the tear though. I ended up having to buy a different pair at the lodge on our trip.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: These are tiny
customer_reviews.text: These would be GREAT gloves, if they weren't so small. I'd have, in fact, buy another in a size up, but I can't return them and so I'm fairly unhappy with the purchase. If I could exchange them, I'd change my review to 5 star. Bummer that the return window was either non-existent or super super short.
customer_reviews.author: Scientist Mom

customer_reviews.title: Touchscreen fingers barely worked
customer_reviews.text: I got these for snowboarding but am going to return them. I was really looking forward to the touch screen feature and they did not work at all. I pushed like 10 times for the finger tap to work. They didnt feel that warm either so o never even tried them out in the cold. I'll be looking for another pair with true touchscreen functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Khosh

customer_reviews.title: Never Dries
customer_reviews.text: Glove fit was bulky. They are warm but also will cause your hand to sweat. Used in snow and had to get them dry. Good luck with that-dried over an hour in dryer, still moist inside. Days over the air vent and they were wearable again. Perfect glove if you plan to use every other week between dry-outs.
customer_reviews.author: GeeGee

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and Snug
customer_reviews.text: So far I like these gloves because they are pretty and snug. They don't look bulky and look very classy. As far as whether they are warm, I am not able to say yet as we have not yet traveled North (we live down South where it's very hot and humid). We will be traveling soon and I will be able to update this review once I've tried them out in cold weather. However, they certainly are insulated and seem to be warm.
customer_reviews.author: EP

customer_reviews.title: A great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Really love these gloves! Super warm and soft! I wore these in Park City, UT in a snowstorm and while playing in the snow. They were totally waterproof and kept my hand toasty warm.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Warm winter gloves but very questionable "water resistant"
customer_reviews.text: Great winter snow gloves. They are a bit bulky but much needed to keep your hands warm. I was disappointed in the "water resistant" aspect - the glove liners were soaking wet when I removed them after skiing or sledding; Not sure if the liner was soaked from sweat or if the moisture got through the gloves. Difficult to put back on once they are removed, until the inside liner dries.
customer_reviews.author: EVM65

customer_reviews.title: high quality gloves that keep me warm and are waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: a little snug, but with a few wearings, fit fine. I like to ski, and they are perfect for that. also, going for a walk on a really cold day, or in the snow, they are just right.
customer_reviews.author: den

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these gloves for a recent ski trip to Colorado. Should have gotten the small or perhaps a different type of glove. Kept my hands warm but fingers were cold. Very thick and hard to grip things. I guess that is the perk of ski gloves. It was a decent purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: ... mainly looking for gloves for a decent price and great for skiing
customer_reviews.text: I was mainly looking for gloves for a decent price and great for skiing. They fit great and will be perfect for skiing. They are warm, and I love that you can tighten the gloves on the top of the hands AND the wrists. I also appreciate that you can attach each glove to your coat wrist (if your coat has a loop, too). It’s not great for phone screen sensitivity as advertised, but I don’t care about that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT for any winter outdoor activities. My fingers were froze in under ten minutes. I bought these for my trip to Iceland and was sorely disappointed with cold fingers. Save your money to spend it on a better pair than these. They do not hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Babygirl116

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gloves at a great value. These are easily as good as more expensive brands that you would find at sports stores. I wore these on a very windy, cold day in the sleet while snow tubing and my hands stayed perfectly warm and dry. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: everlast97

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed one wear and it tore, plus I bought a medium it was too hard to put on so I purchased the large and that’s just as hard to go on. Have to un do the buckle to have a chance of it going on. Then 30mins in 35degrees weather and your fingers start to get numb
customer_reviews.author: TaejhanAceDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Quality is garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Put these on for the first time on the chairlift to the top of the mountain and the wrist strap to tighten the glove snapped. Great place to find out what quality the glove is made of. Once I got to the bottom of the mountain I saw the seam had torn and the inner filling was coming out the side of the glove. First. Time. Wearing. Quality of these gloves is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: JimmiestJames

customer_reviews.title: Soft, comfortable, waterproof, but one seam coming out
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are warm, comfortable, attractive, soft... I really like them. They even have a cool elastic band to keep them on your wrist if you take them off. And they work with the touchscreen. All around nice. Only issue is they arrived with a part of the seam coming undone.
customer_reviews.author: Britt Clarkson

customer_reviews.title: these are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves were awesome! I bought a pair for myself and my wife and they fit perfectly. Make sure you take the time to measure your hands and use the measurement pictures orovided as one of the pictures they show on the items page. We originally got the large one for my wife and they were too big. Luckily were able to return them for the right size and they fit excellent for her. Solid material and quality very glad to have purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Sully

customer_reviews.title: not true to size -
customer_reviews.text: I have fairly small hands for a women and usually wear a medium into a large .... these larges didn't even come close to fitting, I couldn't even get the completely on. not sure if it was mis-sized or what , made in china. returned and did not replace
customer_reviews.author: Kathie W.

customer_reviews.title: "Like a Glove"
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my wife for our ski trip. The gloves fit good and look great with her outfit. The fingertips allow for touch screen without the need to remove them. She got the Small size for her petite hands and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I wasn't expecting too much, but even at $22.00 I thought they would keep my fingers warm while being outside for just 30 minutes. I used these gloves during a long wet day outside and for a short dry but cold day and both were a fail. Only pro is they do come small enough for small hands.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Nice but bulky
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty nice. They are bulky overall for the warmth they provide. Skiing in snowy weather, my fingers began to get cold after a couple hours. Also when my hands get sweaty, the inside glove wants to bunch up when pulled off, so it makes a few fingers have to fight to get back into them. But overall, nice for the price.
customer_reviews.author: L. Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but hands get wet
customer_reviews.text: Used this once - looks pretty. My hands however got wet after half a day skiing. I was reasonably warm (temperatures didn’t fall too low) but wet was unpleasant. I got medium size best on measurements suggested and pinky fingure on both hands would not be comfortable (I was not able to bend it as the gloves would slide off a bit as I use them.
customer_reviews.author: Valentina

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I leave this Friday for Antarctica to do a Penguin Safari...I cannot give a full review as of yet, since we haven't had a chance to actually use these gloves....however, they fit perfectly and we put them under water and they are definitely waterproof, which is important where we are going. I will report back to let you know how they weather the storms where we are going.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: great glove!
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality. Fit is great and they keep the snow from penetrating through to my hands. Also they works great on keeping my hands warm. The key features that make it a great glove are: warm, waterproof, wrist leash, mid-size adjustable collar and screen touchable. And it also works for general winter activities like riding, shoveling, walking, etc. I think they can also be a great outdoor gift.
customer_reviews.author: Yan C

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT keep your fingertips warm at all.
customer_reviews.text: I was not satisfied in the least bit with these gloves .I bought these gloves my girlfriend for a Ski Trip.(Temperatures between 5-25degrees Fahrenheit) The gloves look great upon receiving them and actually do keep your hands warm EXCEPT for the finger tips. I am not sure if it is common amongst all ski gloves, but for your fingertips to be so cold that we considered going to urgent care just to make sure everything was ok after only about 2 hours out is not what I expected .This happened two consecutive days . I would not purchase again .
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after one wear.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves have no breathability. Did not keep my hands warm and held in all moisture keeping hands constantly cold and damp. Attached liner wouldn't stay in place in the fingers and a huge hole tore in the seam of one finger on my first day on the mountain.
customer_reviews.author: Bell

customer_reviews.title: Not really effective
customer_reviews.text: Since these are supposed to be "ski gloves" I expected them to BE EFFECTIVE! These gloves do not keep your fingers warm any better than any other type of gloves. Very disappointed. Good rating for water resistance only.
customer_reviews.author: True Shoppe

customer_reviews.title: Too small, not very good quality.
customer_reviews.text: They are way too small for large gloves. My kids are 11 and 13 and they were too small for both of them. On top of that, they are pretty poor quality. My 11 year old wore them on one snowboarding trip and they’re already ripped.
customer_reviews.author: Joe L

customer_reviews.title: Warm and stylish
customer_reviews.text: Warm and stylish! Love how easy it was to use my phone with these on along side how easy it was to hang around my wrists or hand from my jacket when I wasn’t wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Zentz

customer_reviews.title: Warm and nicely made
customer_reviews.text: My wife wore these gloves on a trip to the mountains. It was 20 degree and heavily snowing. She says they are super warm, never felt the cold even when playing in the snow. Also the touch screen feature actually works. Now she’s the picture taker!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these gloves for skiing and they worked well the first time but at the second time the seams in the fingertips started to come out and there was a hole. Tossed them and went with another brand and pair.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Large didn't fit
customer_reviews.text: The glove was fine, just too big. I was not given the option to exchange it for a smaller size and I had to pay over 1/3 of the price to ship it back. Not happy about either of those things. On a positive note, the glove arrived in one day and seems like a pretty solid glove.
customer_reviews.author: Judith S. Traynor

customer_reviews.title: Warm,  bulky, fit is bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, very warm, haven't tested the waterproof ability yet. Honestly I didn't expect them to be so thick, was looking more for a work glove rather than a sporting gear. I purchased a size small and they have 1/2" at the end of the fingertips. X-Sm would have fit better but that size is not available.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Waggoner

customer_reviews.title: VERY WARM but not very nimble
customer_reviews.text: arctic circle approved to -15F windchill BUT clumsy to use with touchscreen - simply too bulky. these would be fantastic ski/outdoor/hiking gloves where fine motor skills are less important. overall very happy with the gloves but the search continues for one thin enough to operate equipment.
customer_reviews.author: claire dalune

customer_reviews.title: Warm, but stitching came undone after two days
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed with the gloves after the first day and start of the second day. I was snowboarding at Breckenridge and it was 21 degrees outside. By the end of the second day of use, I noticed the stitching on each side of my right glove started coming undone. I am not sure why. I didnt do anything with them out of the norm. So, I am a little disappointed. If the glove didn't come undone, then I would have given these a 5 star rating!! They look good and were warm.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ricciardo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy other gloves and waste money.
customer_reviews.text: Of all the gloves I have purchased these are by far the best. Living in upper Maine there is a lot of snow shoveling and despite constantly moving my hands freeze. Not with these glove. The quality is great. Very nice looking. Size is true. If your fingers get cold these are the gloves you need.
customer_reviews.author: arbiggs

customer_reviews.title: Warmth
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are extremely warm, but not really made for a driving glove as I anticipated. I will use them to clean off the car and walk the dog, but try to find some warm driving gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Williams

customer_reviews.title: Cold hands... STILL
customer_reviews.text: Truly disappointed that my hands do NOT stay warm in these gloves, even though they go into the gloves warm and all I am doing is driving to work! They take on the temperature of my steering wheel :( even though I warm up the car, the steering wheel is NOT warm when it's cold outside. Plus, I can't maneuver my fingers well to change volume/stations on the radio. Bummed... still searching for gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Linda McKeever

customer_reviews.title: Warm and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Just wore these gloves skiing in windy 30-35 degree weather and they kept my hands warm all day. My husband bought much more expensive gloves from a well-known outdoor gear retailer and complained during the ski trip that his hands were cold and his gloves were worthless. For the price, these were perfect.
customer_reviews.author: KMJ

customer_reviews.title: decent gloves
customer_reviews.text: They are a little big on my average-sized hands, but not enough that they're cumbersome to use.
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: beautiful
customer_reviews.text: it is real touch screen. So easy to use my phone without taking off the glove. My fingers were easy to move around. Not like my old glove, this one is so flexible. This is waterproof and snow proof. Perfect to use while skiing.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Choi Photography

customer_reviews.title: Warm gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves they were super warm even against the Whistler weather! Giving 4 stars only because the wrist strap on the right glove broke the first day I used them. Since I was skiing this was a bit of an issue, those straps are pretty useful for chairlifts, etc. Didn’t find the touch screen feature to be super effective but i also didn’t try it out that much since they are so puffy it would be thought to type anything anyway. Other than that, great gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: These gloves were comfortable and warm. My only issue was that I ordered the pink and I got the gray. I sent them back and got the gray again. I needed these for a trip snd was leaving so I did not have time to send them back again.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha Morgan

customer_reviews.title: not waterproof; turn smelly inside after wash
customer_reviews.text: inside of the glove got wet when I once skied in the rain for 10-20 min. after wash, inside of the glove is hard to dry; and after it dries, it leaves some smell on my hands when i use it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Decent gloves
customer_reviews.text: The gloves fit just fine and were very comfortable, but after an hour or two of skiing in 3 degree weather my finger tips were hurting from the cold. I used them again in 35-40 degree weather and my hands remained warm.
customer_reviews.author: Book lover

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gloves for a ski trip and bbn it was everything i expected it fit comfortably and it was warm and water resistant and it was a vibrant pink worked well with my pink coat
customer_reviews.author: Ife

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I used these at a food distribution center warehouse where they had a cold storage freezer. These held up pretty well during my time there and I could go for well over an hour without feeling too cold
customer_reviews.author: Tony H.

customer_reviews.title: Almost too warm
customer_reviews.text: These are great - I wore them outside in the snow for an entire day and my hands were warm the vast majority of the time. The only exception is when standing on the side of a cliff in Iceland with extremely strong, freezing winds, but honestly none of my winter gear was working then. The rest of the time these were so warm that I even took them off for a few minutes at a time to keep from overheating. The one downside is that they’re incredibly good at retaining moisture, so if the inside gets wet at all, you’ll have to use a hairdryer to dry them out so you can continue wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I have weirdly shaped hands (my thumbs are apparently longer than normal) and these still fit great! Kept me very warm and I didn't find any snow melting and seeping through either.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: Not that warm
customer_reviews.text: They "feel" like they will be warm when you put them on but that won't last long, they don't retain heat at all. The fingers are the worst, especially the touch screen fingers. Even with warmers it didn't really help. Probably fine for briefly being outside but no way they work at the temperatures they claim when you are out for any significant time, like when skiing.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Worth  the money.
customer_reviews.text: When you take your fingers out of glove the inside part of fingers come out of finger holes. It is annoying. They should have sown the inner layer in the distal end of fingers
customer_reviews.author: cn

customer_reviews.title: Sweet pair of gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Wow these gloves were a life saver on Mount Snow! For the most part my hands didn't get too cold. I did have another pair of gloves on under them though. I have longer fingers so I got the L and they fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Kamilla

customer_reviews.title: These fit great! I'm an averaged sized female and these gloves ...
customer_reviews.text: These fit great! I'm an averaged sized female and these gloves fit great. They are warm and fairly waterproof. I have yet to find ski gloves that don't get damp inside. The color and design is really sharp too. I liked the pink because it was easy to sort my gloves from everyone else black ones. I would recommend these to friends.
customer_reviews.author: engineer-er

product_meta.title: MCTi Ski Gloves,Winter Waterproof Snowboard Snow 3M Thinsulate Warm Touchscreen Cold Weather Women Gloves Wrist Leashes
feature_bullets: Thinsulate Warmth and Waterproof Insert: Low-bulk ski gloves with 40 grams 3M thermal thinsulate insulations and 120 grams thicken cotton provide hands added warmth. Waterproof TPU insert wick away moisture and help hands stay warm and dry in exercise and play.

Durability and Wear-Resistance: The part between thumb finger and the index is reinforced with PU leather to protect against thumb joints pain in grip and ensures durability. Premium Anti-slip PU leather enhance grip and prevent daily wear and tear.
Touch Screen Fingers: The thumb finger as well as the index and the middle part is covered with shock, can pick up call when skiing, snowboarding and riding without taking off the gloves.
Brand Gloves Holder Wristbands: Equipped with one pair of gloves holder wristbands is in case of gloves lost when taking off the gloves, and prevent sudden thrown out in extreme rapid winter sports.
MCTi gloves are with nose wipe thumb fabric, Logo embroidery, skin touch and comfortable linings fabrics, quality wrist buckles. Medium and Large is available for US women size.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
